data.description: Spring Technologist InternThe Opportunity: The Spring Advanced Technology Internship program is a part-time opportunity that is seeking the very best and brightest highly technical STEM students. The goal is to develop a breakthrough solution in the fields of Agentic AI, Autonomous Systems, or simulation, performing creative and innovative internal R&D work of the highest caliber that can be leveraged to ultimately solve the most pressing, complex, and multidimensional problems that our clients, both current and prospective, may face while developing valuable technical skills as well as an understanding of professional business best practices.Throughout the program, interns will receive mentorship from senior leaders, solve problems using Booz Allen’s products and unique engagement models, and leverage the power of collaboration in a team environment. Join us. The world can’t wait. You Have:  Experience with programming languages, including Python, Java, C, C++, JavaScript, Assembly, Perl, R, or BashExperience in object-oriented programming Experience with AI/ML, autonomous systems, or graphics immersions, such as AR or VR Experience with conducting research and writing software  Ability to work independently and in teamsAbility to obtain a Secret clearance  Scheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics field by Summer 2028 or Winter 2028Nice If You Have:  Experience building Agentic AI systems leveraging Model Context Protocol (MCP) or Agent-to-Agent Protocols (A2A) in relevant frameworks, such as AWS Bedrock AgentCore Experience building Generative AI systems leveraging LLMs for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) Experience building robotics and autonomous systems with the associated software stacks, including reinforcement learning, ROS, computer vision, computer networking, such as TCP/IP, or external sensor data streams Experience working with computer hardware, including GPUs, Arduinos and Raspberry Pis, or external sensors Experience building immersive applications involving AR or VR, digital twins and high-fidelity 3D graphics utilizing tools, such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Blender, or MayaAbility to be a self-starter with exceptional work ethic, drive and motivationAbility to produce technical documentation and create design artifacts  Possession of excellent critical thinking and analytical skills  Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills Clearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $55,200.00 to $126,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.Identity StatementAs part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.Commitment to Non-DiscriminationAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
requirements: Scheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics field by Summer 2028 or Winter 2028
